Description:
About the Role:
As a Solution Designer, you will play a pivotal role in translating complex statements of work into actionable implementation plans. This role requires a unique blend of technical expertise, client consulting, and team leadership. You will be instrumental in creating a seamless bridge between our client‚Äôs vision and our technical team's execution.

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Translate Statements of Work: Consult with clients to transform their requirements into detailed implementation plans.
  • Requirement gathering: Collaboratively work with clients to gather and refine their needs and expectations.
  • Cross-Departmental Collaboration: Engage with customer subject matter experts across different departments such as marketing, clinical, patient access, IT, and finance to synthesize business and technical requirements.
  • Component Identification: Identify all necessary components for successful project implementation.
  • Lead Interdisciplinary Teams: Coordinate with various teams including data science, medical, implementation, engineering, and quality assurance for requirement clarification and solution development.
  • Create Implementation Diagrams: Develop clear and concise diagrams to illustrate the proposed implementation architecture and workflow.
  • Documentation: Create comprehensive documentation to guide and assist technical teams during the implementation phase.
  • Conflict and Change Management: Skillfully manage conflicting requirements and adapt to rapidly changing environments.
  • Ambiguity Resolution: Excel in transforming ambiguity into clarity, providing direction and focus in uncertain scenarios.
  • Adaptability and Curiosity: Demonstrate an inquisitive mindset with the ability to rapidly switch between various tasks and challenges.

Here‚Äôs what we expect from you:

  • 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience in a mid-tier (technical) consulting organization, within a delivery and customer facing role
  • Workshops and large meeting facilitation experience
  • Technical background or experience in software development a plus
  • Experience in healthcare or health IT (eg. EHRs or practice management solutions, HL7) a big plus
  • Technical knowledge around integration systems such as Epic, Cerner, Cisco, Genesys, etc.
  • Integration experience/ focus on integrations
  • BS in Management, Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
  • Exceptional communications skills (email, virtual and in-person meetings)
  • Proficiency in a Project Management System (Jira, Monday, Asana, etc)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft & Google Suite
You will have access to:
üèù Flexible work environment, where you organize your own dynamic: flexible working schedule, extra days off policy and remote work policy - Work from where you feel most comfortable and productive!
üí∞ A competitive salary and the possibility to participate in GYANT‚Äôs Equity plan.
üè• A comprehensive subsidized medical (Anthem/Kaiser), dental and vision insurance, extendable to your dependants.
‚è≥ The option to contribute to your retirement via a 401k plan.
üçº Fully paid and benefited parental leave.
üìö Continuous Learning & Development opportunities with a personal development stipend of $1000.
üèãüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Sponsorship to wellness and fitness.
üéß Home Office budget available to make working remotely more comfortable.
üë• Referral bonus whenever you refer someone to join our awesome team.
üïπ Several team-building events and offsite activities.
üôåüèΩ The possibility to work with colleagues in a coworking space.
And what else?
üí≠ A fast-paced and fun work environment, with room for creativity and innovation.
‚ú® Working on impactful and challenging projects with very skilled and expert colleagues.
üí° Ownership of your work and space to actively contribute with your own vision and ideas.
About GYANT:
GYANT is changing the way health systems connect with patients.
We believe that artificial intelligence can transform the patient experience at different points along the patient journey. Our technology helps patients understand where they need to go when they feel sick or there is a health emergency; when they are in the clinic, we capture the important details and prepare the medical team with that information; and when a patient is recovering from an operation, we make sure the recovery goes smoothly.
Founded in 2016, GYANT is a small and nimble multi-cultural and cross-disciplinary team where each member is an expert in their discipline. We make space for team members to propose how we can reach our strategic goals and we‚Äôre looking for people who get satisfaction from solving problems. We value diverse perspectives, candid feedback, and we‚Äôre excited to bring on team members who will work passionately towards our mission.
GYANT‚Äôs Values:
- Focus on impact - We want to make a difference in the world of healthcare and are motivated to help people at scale.
- Freedom & accountability - We trust each other to make independent decisions and hold each other accountable for results.
- Meritocracy of ideas - Everyone at GYANT has a voice, and we make decisions based on objective criteria to implement the best ideas.
- Intensity - We work passionately towards our vision and understand that this is a marathon, not a sprint.
- Candor - We give and accept candid, respectful feedback in service of personal and professional development.
- Personal development - We strive to better ourselves and help each other grow.
We want you to know:
You can be a great candidate even if you don‚Äôt fit everything we‚Äôve described above. You can also have important skills that we haven‚Äôt thought of. If that‚Äôs you, please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself.
GYANT is an equal opportunity employer. We‚Äôre committed to diversity and building an equitable and inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and experiences, and we‚Äôre taking continued steps to meet that commitment. We especially encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women and other gender minorities, people of color, LGBTQIA people, veterans, and people with disabilities.

Location

Brighton, MI - United States of America (USA)

About Us

Blueflite designs and manufactures high performance, electric, unmanned, aerial tilt-rotor vehicles for the delivery of light cargo. Our UAV platform is scalable and has unique and patent-pending design characteristics resulting in advanced capability regarding maneuverability and vehicle control. blueflite has extensive experience in carbon fiber structure design and manufacturing, design of propulsion systems, developing advanced flight control algorithms, implementation of code in on-board computer systems, and developing a digital ground infrastructure.

We are searching for team members to support the continued development of blueflite‚Äôs existing and future UAV platforms. We are looking for innovative and solutions-oriented engineers and entrepreneurs to be part of our amazing technology development journey; creating the next generation of logistic technology platform centered on our unique, agile, and robust UAV design.

About The Role

Drive the continuous improvement of our vehicle hardware platform towards the singular goal of a truly industry startling vehicle with unparalleled performance and robustness. Day to day work at blueflite centers around an agile approach in small teams of brilliant scientists, engineers, software developers, technicians, pilots, and experts all working towards a world class UAS technology platform. Candidates should prove their experience in design applications, a system learning approach to making informed decisions about the platform, and/or experience in scaling manufacturing.

Main areas of responsibility for design role:

  • Lightweight structure design and analysis
  • Advanced flight critical tilting propulsion systems
  • Electronic system packaging and cooling
  • Support vehicle performance optimization
  • Build physical design prototypes and assist with integration on the vehicle

About You
  • Experience working in small agile teams
  • Great attitude and communication skills
  • Composite design and advanced additive manufacturing experience
  • 3+ years of manufacturing/design experience in an applicable engineering field √† Aerospace preferred
  • Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent) √† Master‚Äôs Degree preferred
  • Experience working with NX and Teamcenter PLM
  • Holds legal right to work in the United States

Benefits

Paid Time Off | Health Insurance | Dental | Vision | Equity

LawnStarter is the leading on-demand platform for lawn care and landscaping services in the US, and our vision is to be the one-stop shop for all outdoor home services. Over the past 9 years, we‚Äôve grown to 120 metro areas, raised $30 million in funding, and acquired our biggest competitor, solidifying our leadership in the space.

The Senior UX/UI Designer at LawnStarter is responsible for the entire design cycle of given projects, from discovery to design handoff to engineering. This is a highly collaborative role, with the ultimate goal of creating great user experiences through research, innovation, and consistent processes.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Work collaboratively to align the product experience with business goals, growth strategy and brand.
  • Create user flows, site maps, wireframes, visual designs, low and high fidelity interactive prototypes for product changes and new functionality.
  • Create design systems, modules, elements, and components to ensure consistency throughout the entire customer journey.
  • Help drive engagement and conversion rate improvements and ideate experiments by deeply understanding prospective customer behavior, identifying friction points.
  • Conduct and prioritize A/B tests to measure the impact of your design changes to further optimize performance.

Who You Are

  • You have experience in designing and shipping conversion, data-backed designs. Creating high-quality end-to-end flows from landing pages to onboarding, and activation features.
  • You have expert design instincts & best practice knowledge to translate user problems, user goals, business objectives, and technical constraints into excellent product experiences to deliver quick turnarounds & shorten feedback loops.
  • You are curious and have a self-starter mindset.
  • You foster collaborative relationships between all business stakeholders.
  • You‚Äôre excited about working in a dynamic startup environment.

Location: Berlin, Germany ¬∑ Ulm, Germany ¬∑ Berlin, MD, USA ¬∑ Hof, Germany ¬∑ Berlin, Germany ¬∑ Tegel, Berlin, Germany
Description:
Ahoy Kptn!

Are you enthusiastic about design and graphics and also a real foodie? Then we might be a match!
We are looking for an intern for 4-6 months in Graphic Design to join our team in Berlin and make significant contributions to our mission of empowering people to make the best food choices.

WHY US?

The Crew
  • Flat hierarchies and transparent communication
  • A young and highly motivated team
  • Many team events
Flexibility
  • A beautiful office in Berlin Neuk√∂lln
  • Flexible working hours and the possibility of working from home
  • Equipment for hybrid work
Professional development
  • Regular check-ins to encourage your professional development
  • Lead varied tasks and initiatives
  • Bring your ideas to the table and take over responsibilities from day 1
Other Perks
  • After-Work-BBQs and cooking sessions in our lovely courtyard
  • Fresh food from our studio test kitchen
  • Free BVG Ticket

YOUR TASKS

  • You create illustrations and graphics for our app content, social media & marketing channels, events, and campaigns
  • You work on the UI design of our app
  • You support our content team with picture editing
  • You support projects from conception to finalization
  • You support our sales team in creating presentations

WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING ON BOARD

  • You are currently studying visual communication, graphic, communication, or media design or a comparable course with a focus on design
  • You are looking for an internship for at least 4 months (enrolled in university during this time)
  • You describe yourself as creative and conceptually strong in working independently
  • No matter if it's Pixel or Vector - you are fit in the Adobe Creative Cloud
  • You have already gained your first practical design experiences and can show them in a portfolio
  • You are a team player, committed, open and communicative
No one is perfect. If you don't tick all the boxes but have the desire to grow into it ‚Äì then it's you who we are looking for.

ABOUT KPTNCOOK

After founding the company in 2014, KptnCook became Germany's leading food & shopping app. We won several international awards like the Google Material Design Award 2018 and German Design Award 2020 and help hundreds of thousands of users to become better cooks at home every day. Currently, we are a team of around 40 people based in Berlin Neuk√∂lln.

JOIN OUR CREW

Would you like to become part of our crew and set out for international waters?
Then send us your application with your CV, your earliest starting date, and a cover letter that best expresses your interests and qualifications.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.

Design at Preply

At Preply, we know learning with the right tutor can be life-changing. Helping to change the lives of people is an amazing opportunity and a big responsibility. It takes a large, diverse, multidisciplinary team to create a learning product, and Design is at the very heart of that team.

Preply‚Äôs Design mission is to deliver the most beautiful language-learning experience in the world. As the poet once wrote, ‚ÄúBeauty is truth. Truth is beauty.‚Äù We take this definition to heart. We craft beautiful surfaces that delight our users and inspire them to learn and teach. But we also dive deep and go beyond surface beauty, to uncover the truth behind our users‚Äô needs and motivations. By combining all of this, we create holistic experiences that help our users achieve their goals.

To achieve our mission, we need the best designers out there. We need creative thinkers, great product "detectives", and people who care about their impact on the world.

Product-Led Growth

Learning is about more than achieving a goal or performing a task. It's a journey of self-discovery and improvement. That's why at Preply we talk about "learning journeys": we think the metaphor of a "journey" captures the essence of the transformation that learners go through. They start in one place, end in another, and are changed in the process.

And, just like in a real-life journey, there are amazing moments that learners should be able to share with the people they care about: moments of pride, moments of achievement, moments worth celebrating. As the Product-Led Growth designer, you will help learners uncover and share these moments with the world, while simultaneously spreading the word about the power of Preply in the process.

Your work will help motivate today's learners to complete their journeys and inspire future learners to begin their own.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Collaborating closely with product and engineering peers, you will own and perfect this make or break segment of a learner‚Äôs journey.
  • You will also partner with your Growth designers to ensure a coherent, consistent and delightful experience for all new learners from the moment they arrive to the moment they commit to learning with a tutor
  • Finally, you will play an important role in Preply‚Äôs larger design and product org by contributing to Preply‚Äôs Design System and helping create a bespoke, app-centric Preply Design Language

What you need to succeed:

  • Minimum of 4+ years of professional Product Design experience
    Compelling, proven professional experience as a product designer.
    Experience in conducting and leading research, and leveraging insights to do excellent product ‚Äúdetective‚Äù work.
    Strong communication skills to effectively present your work and bring key stakeholders on board. You are confident in your ideas but open to learning from others.
    You have experience handing off work to engineers, the dedication and focus to work alongside them to ensure high quality design on launch.
    You have the drive to share work early and often, and to foster a mindset of collective ownership and effort. You leave the ego at the door.
    As a plus, we value any experience working on the ‚Äúseller side‚Äù (e.g. content creators, sellers, advertisers, ‚Ä¶) of marketplaces, as well as experience using emotional design to deliver ‚Äúdelightful‚Äù experiences
    A portfolio to help us understand your skills and experience as a designer.

Why you‚Äôll love it at Preply:

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
  • A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
  • Access to free mental health support platforms;
  • The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).

Our Principles

  • Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
  • We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
  • Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Are you ready to dive into the world of a fast-paced tech startup? Are you ready to change the world? At PadSplit we're disrupting the affordable housing industry by creating safe, attractive, and respectable co-living environments. If you're motivated by the conviction that working people should have a decent place to live, and want to do something about it, come join us!
At PadSplit, our purpose is to solve our affordable housing crisis one room at a time while leveraging housing as a vehicle for financial independence. Our principles are Care, Show it, Prove it. We live out our principles by embodying our values: Empathy, Optimism, Intellectual Curiosity, Strong Work Ethic, High Integrity, Self-Awareness, and Compassionate Directness.

Summary:
Our company is seeking a talented and experienced Marketing Designer to join our creative team. As a Marketing Designer, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our brand presence through visually compelling designs across various platforms. The ideal candidate should have strong exposure in the design industry and possess a strong skill set in animation, motion designing, social media graphics, and landing page design.

You Will:

  • Create engaging graphics and animations for social media platforms, ensuring a consistent and visually appealing brand representation.
  • Craft motion designs like Instagram reels with a quick turnaround to meet dynamic marketing needs.
  • Design and modify landing pages as requested, maintaining a user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing online presence.
  • Collaborate seamlessly with the senior designer to integrate design guidelines and maintain brand consistency.
  • Demonstrate proficiency in design tools, including Figma, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Photoshop.
  • Adapt quickly to changes and efficiently produce high-quality design work within tight deadlines.
  • Possesses a keen eye for typography, spacing, and overall design aesthetics.
  • Work in a fast-paced environment, ensuring accuracy and precision in all design deliverables.

You Have:

  • 3-4 years of experience in a marketing design role, preferably in a fast-paced industry.
  • Proficiency in Figma, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Photoshop.
  • Strong portfolio showcasing expertise in social media graphics, animations, and landing page design.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Detail-oriented with a commitment to maintaining brand guidelines.
  • Adaptability and a proactive approach to evolving design requirements.
  • Knowledge of tools like Slack and Canva for effective communication and collaborative design processes.
Full time - Contractor

TransUnion's Job Applicant Privacy Notice

What We'll Bring:

At TransUnion, we have a welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We are consistently exploring new technologies and tools to be agile. This environment gives our people the opportunity to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.
Come be a part of our team ‚Äì you‚Äôll work with great people, pioneering products and cutting-edge technology.

What You'll Bring:

What You'll Bring:

  • We‚Äôre looking for someone with the mindset of a systems thinker/digital marketer, the pragmatism of a technologist and sensibilities of a developer, with a strong bias for action and results
  • 10 years of marketing experience, ideally with a background in Web Development with a professional and personal portfolio of useful and collaborative digital solutions across a variety of media. At least 2 of those years should have leadership responsibilities.
  • A real desire to understand and improve the user and prospect experience. A strong critical thinker with a relentless curiosity to listen to and explore new ideas from everywhere
  • Great networking and influencing skills are a must, as is excellent agile management skills and relentlessly high standards
  • Group management experience to build a group of individual contributors into a team of trusted partners with a consistent eye toward incremental improvement of throughput (operational efficiency).
  • Experience with the information architecture, page design, and usability testing within a web environment.
  • Partner with global marketing team stakeholders in identifying strategic solutions to meet their product and campaign needs that align with global website goals.
  • Ability to test code changes through cross-browser testing to identify and resolve technical issues.
  • Understanding of Responsive Web Design and ability to code using responsive frameworks (Bootstrap, Angular.js, etc.)
  • Understanding of W3C standards as well as browser-specific bugs and variations, including Chrome, Safari, IE and Mozilla.
  • Experience with website performance analytics, SEM, and SEO and confident at learning, testing and adopting new tools.

We‚Äôd love to see:

  • Experience with content management systems and content as a service
  • Knowledge of mobile first and responsive content strategies
  • Personalization, targeting, and A/B test design experience

Impact You'll Make:

‚Ä¢ You will analyze the user journey across the digital experience, and leverage these insights to inform tests to iterate upon the current flow, driving improved results

‚Ä¢ In collaboration with the B2B & B2C marketing teams, you‚Äôll guide strategy and execution for a production team of developers to improve digital experiences up and down the sales funnel

‚Ä¢ You will nurture key relationships with influencers, agency partners, business partners and users to craft compelling experiences and ensure timely delivery to the marketing partners

‚Ä¢ You will lead, guide and inspire the creation, curation, publishing, testing and governance of relevant, usable and engaging web experiences for the global TransUnion websites.

‚Ä¢ You will partner with UX leads, visual and interactive designers, information architects, developers, agile product teams and the insights team to optimize the webpage elements based on usability, intuitiveness, consistency, business metrics and time to market

Impact You'll Make:

It is a requirement of the Global Capability Centre Africa that you reside in a home that is fibre ready; and has space for you to be able to work comfortably and confidentially on a day-to-day basis for the purpose of your proposed employment. You can be based anywhere in South Africa and will not be able to work in a location outside of South Africa.

A Minimum of a 100 Meg Fibre line is required, should you be successful, you will need to upgrade your line in order to work effectively.

Description:
Acclinate Inc. Graphic Designer Remote ¬∑ Full time

Acclinate, a healthcare technology company focused on improving health equity through inclusive research, seeks an experienced Graphic Designer to own all creative and brand design initiatives, including: creating visually captivating designs for our NOWINCLUDED advertising (both print and digital), developing project landing pages, producing printed marketing materials, and addressing any other design needs related to the Acclinate brand.

Description

Responsibilities:

  • Develop visually appealing and effective ad creatives for NOWINCLUDED and our healthcare-focused projects
  • Design engaging and user-friendly landing pages for our clinical study-specific projects
  • Create print marketing materials for both Acclinate (B2B, pharmaceutical focused), and NOWINCLUDED (B2C, community building), partnering with marketing as needed
  • Own the Acclinate brand design, ensuring consistency and alignment with the brand guidelines
  • Own the strategy for user experience, keeping track of all user journeys and entry points (online and in person) to keep all experiences cohesive
  • Work closely with the Marketing team to understand design requirements and contribute creative insights to projects
  • Be adaptable and responsive to various design requests, consistently meeting deadlines and maintaining high-quality design standards

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience (3-5 years) as a Graphic Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing a range of design work
  • Proficiency in graphic design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and Figma
  • Experience building websites in Webflow
  • Experience in designing ad creatives for digital platforms like Meta and Google, particularly for community-focused initiatives
  • Strong understanding of print design principles and experience in creating print marketing materials
  • Familiarity with brand design and the ability to maintain consistency across various design assets
  • Creative mindset, staying updated on design trends, and bringing innovative ideas to the table
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams

Desired:

  • Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communications, or a related field.
  • Experience working with health-related or community-focused brands.
  • Familiarity with UX/UI design principles.
  • Animation or video editing skills.
  • Agency experience

Salary and Employee Benefits:

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package designed to attract and retain top talent. Here's what you can expect:

  • Competitive salary commensurate with your experience and qualifications.
  • Participation in our company equity program.
  • Access to health, dental, and vision insurance plans, with the company covering half of the premium costs.
  • Access to a 401(k) retirement plan to help you secure your financial future.
  • Enjoy 22 paid holidays throughout the year.
  • Receive an educational stipend to support your ongoing professional development.
  • A technology allowance to keep you equipped with the tools you need.
  • Generous paid time off to recharge and maintain work-life balance.

At Acclinate, we are dedicated to making a difference in the world. If you want to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply.

Salary

$50,000 - $70,000 per year
